summary: Sodium hydroxide (NaOH) is a white solid chemical compound. It is a strong base that can harm skin and eyes. This substance is highly reactive with water and air, easily forming hydrates. Sodium hydroxide is used in various industries, such as paper-making, soap production, and cleaning. It is one of the most common bases, often used in science classes to teach about pH levels. Its production and use are significant globally.
title: Sodium hydroxide
